meanings.definition: Remove dead, damaged, or infected tissue from a wound.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will debride the wound to help it heal faster.
meanings.sent2: It is important to debride the wound to prevent infection.
meanings.sent3: After the surgery, the wound was debrided, and it looked much better.
meanings.sent4: She felt like debriding the negative thoughts from her mind to feel more positive.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to debride the burnt area to clear out any remaining debris.

meanings.definition: To clean a wound by removing debris or foreign material.
meanings.sent1: The nurse will debride the wound to make sure it is free from any dirt.
meanings.sent2: Remember to debride the wound gently to avoid causing more pain.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to debride its fur after rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent4: She decided to debride her messy room by clearing out all the clutter.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to debride the plant's leaves to remove the pests.
